TopicTitle: Build a Sentence... One Word at a Time!

new:

David the Gnome

———

Spoiler

130704302024

Hmm...

Guys, I've thought about this a bit, here's what I have to say:

I know I said that full names would be allowed in one post, but I increasingly feel this goes against the spirit of the game. I think if you want to do a name, you can make it clear by capitalizing the first letter, but it's up to the next person to add a title to the name (again, one word at a time) or a last name, or a middle name, or whatever. Anything posted previously is fine, but remember this in future posts.

David the Gnome ate

David the Gnome ate Aequeosalinocalcalinoceraceoaluminosocupreovitriolic

Spoiler

Yes, thats a real word.

David the Gnome ate Aequeosalinocalcalinoceraceoaluminosocupreovitriolic paste, and vomited lopado­temacho­selacho­galeokranio­leipsano­drim­hypotrimmato­silphio­karabo­melitokatakechy­meno­kichl­epikossypho­phatto­peristeralektryon­opte­kephallio­kigklopeleio­lagoio­siraio­baphetragano­pterygon into pneumono­ultra­micro­scopic­silico­volcano­coniosis

Yup.

182405012024

vomiting can lead to aspiration into the lungs. So yup!

182905012024

Edited May 1 by AlamoVampire
Wait, what's confusing me is the "into" part. How does your vomit reach the inside of a non-object?

@Kimera Industries your esophagus and trachea are interconnected. When a person vomits and is unlucky or laying down (its why you roll a vomiting person onto his/her side) there is a chance the vomit can go down into the lungs which can cause lethal issues. I just picked a lung related disease because of the word vomit and well the fact vomit can enter the lungs in certain circumstances.
